name: UCLA Loneliness Scale (Version 3)
description: A 20-item measure designed to assess subjective feelings of loneliness and social isolation. The most widely used loneliness measure in research.
reference: Russell, D. W. (1996). UCLA Loneliness Scale (Version 3): Reliability, validity, and factor structure. Journal of Personality Assessment, 66(1), 20-40.
instructions: Indicate how often you feel the way described in each of the following statements.

questions.name: ucla_1
questions.description: How often do you feel that you are 'in tune' with the people around you?

questions.name: ucla_2
questions.description: How often do you feel that you lack companionship?

questions.name: ucla_3
questions.description: How often do you feel that there is no one you can turn to?

questions.name: ucla_4
questions.description: How often do you feel alone?

questions.name: ucla_5
questions.description: How often do you feel part of a group of friends?

questions.name: ucla_6
questions.description: How often do you feel that you have a lot in common with the people around you?

questions.name: ucla_7
questions.description: How often do you feel that you are no longer close to anyone?

questions.name: ucla_8
questions.description: How often do you feel that your interests and ideas are not shared by those around you?

questions.name: ucla_9
questions.description: How often do you feel outgoing and friendly?

questions.name: ucla_10
questions.description: How often do you feel close to people?

questions.name: ucla_11
questions.description: How often do you feel left out?

questions.name: ucla_12
questions.description: How often do you feel that your relationships with others are not meaningful?

questions.name: ucla_13
questions.description: How often do you feel that no one really knows you well?

questions.name: ucla_14
questions.description: How often do you feel isolated from others?

questions.name: ucla_15
questions.description: How often do you feel you can find companionship when you want it?

questions.name: ucla_16
questions.description: How often do you feel that there are people who really understand you?

questions.name: ucla_17
questions.description: How often do you feel shy?

questions.name: ucla_18
questions.description: How often do you feel that people are around you but not with you?

questions.name: ucla_19
questions.description: How often do you feel that there are people you can talk to?

questions.name: ucla_20
questions.description: How often do you feel that there are people you can turn to?
